meanings.definition: To provide or accommodate with a room or rooms.
meanings.sent1: The hotel roomed us comfortably during our vacation.
meanings.sent2: The landlord roomed the new tenant in the cozy apartment.
meanings.sent3: The friendly innkeeper roomed the travelers with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The school principal roomed the students strategically for the group project.
meanings.sent5: The kind host roomed the guests in the spacious guesthouse.

meanings.definition: Having a specified number or type of rooms.
meanings.sent1: The large house was well-roomed with five bedrooms.
meanings.sent2: The hotel advertised its well-roomed suites for guests.
meanings.sent3: The roomed mansion stood out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The roomed cabin provided a peaceful retreat in the woods.
meanings.sent5: The roomed apartment complex offered various living options.

meanings.definition: To occupy a room or rooms.
meanings.sent1: The students roomed together during the school trip.
meanings.sent2: The family roomed in the beachfront villa for the summer.
meanings.sent3: The friends roomed together for a fun weekend getaway.
meanings.sent4: The travelers roomed in the quaint bed and breakfast.
meanings.sent5: The guests roomed in the historic hotel during their visit.
